localString.value: Patherine's daddy has uncovered some monsters in a treehouse on Gurnal Island. You should find her daddy, then go and slay the monsters.
You have slain the lich that was living in the treehouse in Gurnal Island.
1. The Four Guiding Principles

This is intended to clarify some basic principles and rules for everyone to keep in mind while spending time on the Server. These guidelines are here to allow the majority of you, the players, to have a chance to fully enjoy the game. They are more closely explained in other journal entries, and at www.playzen.net forums.
1. Ingame the DM is Always Right 2. No excess foul language 3. Use common courtesy 4. Roleplay
2. Guidelines for Player Conduct

1. InGame The DM is ALWAYS Right No matter what your interpretation of the rules tells you, the DMs have the final word. Do not "shout" your objections to their decisions ingame. If you do not agree with a ruling, or feel a DM has mistreated you, use the DM channel to discuss this with them directly, post your question or comments in the forums. Do not argue with a DM. It is up to the DMs judgement whether you are breaking a rule.
2. Foul Language Should be limited, especially in the daytime (pre 9pm GMT) For cases where you are unsure if something is considered to be "foul language" refer to rule #1. If you are still not sure, then do not use the word(s) you are considering.
3. Be Considerate of Others
A. The shout channel is a useful tool, however please limit the use to necessity. If you do need to use the shout channel please do so, but give someone time (a minimum of 3 minutes) to respond to you via 'Tell' before issuing more shouts.
B. Do not loot anything that you did not kill... the final blow is not always dealt by the person who actually killed the beast.
C. When in a group, finish the fight before searching the corpses... your party member(s) probably need your help and the loot is not going anywhere.
D. If you run from a monster, try not to lead it onto unsuspecting players. If this does happen, help them defeat the beast (they maybe weaker than you)... be sure to apologize and thank them for the aid.
E. Avoid camping an Area Camping is defined as staying in one area waiting for creatures to respawn and by doing so denying other players of that area's use. This is a RolePlaying server. It is not a powerleveling server. If you only strive for level 20 and "uber gear" perhaps you would be happier elsewhere.
F. If somebody is harassing you, or doing "tells" to you that you find insulting take a screen pic (print screen button = pic will be in NWN folder as a TGA file) and give it to a DM. Do not "take matters into your own hands".
4. Roleplay is Required If you find that RolePlaying is not something you enjoy perhaps you would feel more comfortable in a server hosted under another Gamestyle.
5. Not All NPCs in the World of Nordock are Combatants Do not kill NPCs unless they ask for a fight in their conversation, or unless they are a NPC Guard.
3. Regarding Player versus Player combat

PvP is only permitted under one of the following circumstances 1. The Arena 2. Both parties have consented 3. The Encounter is role played and there is an opportunity for the weaker character to back down 4. Once PvP is started it must be concluded in one way or another before either player disconnects. If your network connection fails, post an appology on the forums and arrange with the other player to have a rematch. Conclusion can mean that one PC runs for the hills and hides but that PC must leave the other PC 2 zones behind before it can be assumed that the encounter is over.
4. Theives

Pick Pocketing (PP) is a special form of PvP and follows slightly different rules as asking "please can I steal from you?" is a bit silly. These rules are designed to make playing a rogue thief possible whilst being fair to other players. They apply to any creature you pick pocket that is not of a violent nature towards you prior to the act.
1. The 'victim' must not be rated effortless or easy. They should stand a chance. 2. You must set your victim to Hostile before you pickpocket him. 3. PP is considered an aggressive action and thus consent for agressive reactions. 4. Obviously never use a game engine exploit to steal, this is bannable. 5. Leave non-combatent NPC's alone. If they become combatent only because of a botched pp attempt you must not harm them or lead them out of their area. 6. If you are caught in the act it is likely someone will try to have revenge, you may run or defend yourself, you may fight back, you may not log out until you are 2 zones clear of them. The fugue is considered 2 zones clear ;) Be warned, this kind of action could lead to players putting a bounty on your head.
5. Bounty Hunting

1. A bounty may be set by any character on any character. The bounty can be for the death, capture or return of property. The setting of the bounty must be in character.
2. On accepting the bounty the acceptance and the motivation to accept must be posted on the Bulletin Board for all to see. A DM may cancel the acceptance if he feels it has been made out of character. The hunter must set themselves to 'dislike' the other hunted whenever they see they are on the server.. The bounty is then considered live for a period of one month. At the end of this month (real month not game month) the bounty hunter must contact the client and if the offer is still open may repost that he is continuing his quest. The DM may rule that the bounty is out of date, if you find your bounty removed from the board then its over. You are not permitted to take the same bounty more than three (3) times.
3. At the time of the encounter the following rules must be observed. >a. both players are consdered to have consented to pvp, provided the rules previously have been followed thus far. So either may attack the other at any time. >b. Neither player must intentionally disconnect from the server until there is a 2 zone gap between them. >c. Any encounter must be resolved prior to disconnect either by escape, submision or death.
4. If you are disconnected unintentionally (isp problems) it is your responsibility to make efforts to contact the other player, via forums for example and arrange a rematch or offer an acceptable explanation.
5. If the hunter or hunted is killed then the bounty is over. The hunter may collect the head from the hunted's body in order to prove his success. If the hunter is killed he has to repost his acceptance of the bounty should he want to continue.
6. Collection. The head of the dead player is considered proof of a kill. If a player can prove they have completed the required bounty and the character does not wish to pay, this is considered an agressive act. This is also not something an honourable character would do. If they cannot prove that they have completed the bounty then refusal to pay is NOT considered an aggressive act.
7. Hiding in town. You are not permitted to *hide* in a non-pvp area to escape a bounty hunter. A DM will be quite within his rights to alter your faction and send 'the law' after you should you try this. That is not to say he will do this it will depend on the particular situation.
6. Bugs & Exploits

There are ways to bypass an areas PvP setting. Doing so is a serious offense. In addition, any player caught exploiting any "bugs" in the game or in the server scripts will be dealt with accordingly. If you find a "bug", "exploit", or player using any of the above please report them to a DM via the forums so they may be dealt with for the betterment of the entire server.
Please note, the DM's consider logging out to avoid death an exploit. please ensure that when you log out there are no monsters in the immediate vicinity, no players in line of sight and that any PvP that you have been involved in is 'resolved'.
Twinking is the act of handing powerful magic down from your high level character to your low level character. Twinking is considered an exploit. You *are* allowed to transfer these items by selling them to your lower level characters at the value a shopkeeper places on them. Stay with the spirit of these rules and avoid 'circular twinking'. If you take the piss a dm will strip the items from both your characters and hit the kill button, possibly several times. ;-) Please do not report them to a character played by someone who is also a dm. We like to play too.
7. Final Word

Just because these rules do not say you shouldn't do something, doesn't mean you should do it. Always refer to the Four Guiding Principles. Consider the rules here your first warning, and the Entrance Guide your second� there is no guarantee you will get a third.
8. Website & Forums

You can find this server's website at: www.playzen.net You may use the "Forums" there to post questions, read about updates, gain general knowledge of this server and generally join in more with the gaming community. You may also be interested to visit irc:quakenet #playzen.
Please note this is a heavily adapted version of the Nordock world. Adapted by the ntfm team they are now working on a new world called Ferhan. It's bigger and better than nordock as we've learned alot from mistakes made here. read more about it on the forums above or at http://www.ntfm.org. A ferhan website is being put together too and you may find it at http://www.ferhan.org.
A Dark Tome
You have found a mysterious tome in a cave deep beneath Tobaro. Only a wizard skilled in deciphering magical texts would be able to identify it.

Werdna has identified the tome as belonging to a drow named Blackavar. He has given you a key to his lair in the Plains of Sholo, where you must find the crystal philactory holding his soul, and destroy it.
You turned down Werdna's offer to help rid the land of the evil that is Blackavar.
You should return to Werdna with the Token of Possession.

Werdna has told you that the Token of Possession is a key that allows Blackavar's minions to access his domain. He wants you to track down Galdor the Gold in Benzor who will be able to provide more information.
Galdor thinks that the dark magic detected on the northern half of Misty Isle may be linked to Blackavar. He wants you to investigate.
The riddler in the Tower of Inodrio on Misty Isle has given you a scroll detailing the items he needs to allow you to pass: - Braveheart. - The head of a Drow High Priestess. - Brock's Dagger.
You have received a key to the Tower of Inodrio. You should see if you can find a pedastool to use Galdor's enchanted Token of Posession on.
For destroying Blackavar's summoning pillar, Galdor has rewarded you with a Pendant of the Golden Wing. It can be used 3 times a day to instantly transport you to various places in the realm.
A Kobold Infestation
Guard Captain Vilmalia has asked you to defeat the Kobold tribe that has set up camp in the underdark's water supply. She wants you to find the Kobold Shaman's Staff and return it to her.
You found a staff of a Kobold Shaman. Take it to Guard Captain Vilmalia as proof that you have slain the tribe.
You have shown the Kobold Shaman Staff to Guard Captain Vilmalia and received your reward.
A Package For Vesur
Noinus Confaar has given you a bag of supplies to take to his cousin Vesur outside the Weary Rest Inn in the Eastern March.
You delivered the sack of supplies to Vesur in the Eastern March.
A Powerful Lich
Ameniel, in a house just north of Tobaro, has instructed you to slay a very powerful Lich on Gurnal Island.
You were successful in slaying the lich on Gurnal Island, and Ameniel has rewarded you with a holy shield and longsword.
A Trio of Dragons

Galdor the Gold wants you to investigate an evil developing in the Benzor Swamp.
For some time, a band of kobolds has been camping in the Benzor Swamp. This in itself is only a minor irritation, but a few weeks ago...events took a darker turn. Hordes of kobolds poured out of the swamp. They were followed by lizard folk and the lot of them threw themselves against the city's defenses. Fortunately, a brave band of adventurers was able to stem the tide. I sent this band into the swamp to investigate the mystery behind the attack. It turns out that a trio of black dragons were behind the assault. The heroes confronted and slew the beasts, but not before the foul beasts bragged about an excavation that was almost complete. I fear that the darkness that I now sense close to Benzor is an ancient evil that these lizard creatures have awoken. So you and any brave companions you can find are to journey into the swamp area...go north out of the city and find the path towards the swamps to the east, behind the old quarry. Find out the source of the evil and I shall reward you greatly.
The mystical enscriptions found on Sregtur's Rune of Power have been shown to Galdor.
Bloodstained Note
You have found a note on one of the militia men outside Benzor. Captain Tucker would be interested to see it.
Captain Tucker has asked you to investigate an orc cave on the north side of Benzor River Valley. He would like you to bring back the shaman's head.
You have killed the Orc Shaman in the cave outside Benzor, and returned his head to Captain Tucker.
Galdor has a gift for you.
Galdor has given you a key to the village of Bren. He talks of a Slaad living there known as Rudash who will be able to give you some special items.
Denzecht Vendersh
Fraucht Vendersh has given you a note to take to his brother, Denzecht. Denzecht is a slave, working in a magical tower in a great drow city.
You have delivered Fraucht's note to his brother in Chaulssin.
Gnolls in the Lighthouse

A group of gnolls has taken over the lighthouse in Kabu, forcing Lanaldo in Fort Fakualt to charge higher prices for boat trips. He promises to lower his prices for you if you can bring back the head of Bringus - the Gnolls' chieftan.
Lanaldo in Fort Fakualt has lowered his boat prices for you in return for clearing out the Lighthouse.
Gracklstugh Sewers
Goisur wants you to investigate reports of an undead presence in the sewers beneath Gracklstugh. You should fully explore the sewer system and then report back to him.
You have explored the Gracklstugh and should now report back to Goisur.
Goisur has asked you to go back into the sewers and find the undead spawning grounds. Return to him once you have killed all the undead there.
The sewers beneath Gracklstugh are now free of undead.
Kobolds In The Swamp
A guard named Tald has warned you of a hostile kobold tribe in the Benzor Swamp. He wants you to kill the Kobold Shaman and retrieve his staff.
You found a staff of a Kobold Shaman. Take it to captain tucker as proof that you have slain the tribe.
You have shown the Kobold Shaman Staff to Captain Tucker and received your reward.
Legendary Farm
Farmer John has given you a key to the first stage of the Legendary Farm. He wants you to return with a trophy from the Cow Farm.
Farmer John now wants you to complete the Chicken Trial.
You have completed both trials at the Legendary Farm.
Missing Jewelry
Davis, the innkeeper in Fort Fakualt, has given you a necklace to take to his brother in Fakualt City's Inn of Mist.

Although Larry was happy to have received his necklace from Davis, he explained to you how he lost his Diamond Ring to a group of goblins during a raid on the city. He thinks they might have taken it back to their camp in the ruins of Penna Village, to the north of Fakualt City.
As a reward for bringing back all his jewelry, Larry has given you a magical ring he found.
Penguin Essence
Magical Trevor has promised to make you an Arctic Orb if you bring him some Penguin Essence. Legendary Penguins are rumored to have their hideout in the frosty caves north of Benzor.
Magical Trevor created you an Arctic Orb from the Penguin Essence your brought him.
Red Beetle Disease
Muriando Dattias has given you a vial to take to Malk's Magic Shop. He hopes Malk will be able to create an elixir to cure the Red Beetle disease affecting his crops.
Now that he has a cure for the Red Beetle Disease, Farmer Dattias can continue to harvest his crops.
Ricky's Escape
Ricky Benner wants you to help him escape from his cell.
You told a guard about Ricky's secret tunnel - improving your reputation with the guards of Brosna.
By helping Ricky Benner escape, you have released a determined thief back onto the streets of Brosna.
Shiney Things
The waitress in the Tyln Castle Inn has lost her master's prized silverware. She mentions that the orcs in the Black Hills are known for stealing belongings from passers by.
You have returned the Tyln Silverware to the waitress in the inn.
Tax Collector
Prisonmaster Borris has asked you to collect some tax money from Shelly Dibbles in Benzor.
You turned down Shelly's bribe, and have decided to return to Prisonmaster Borris with the tax money.
By turning down a bribe, you have proven yourself an honest and reliable citizen of Brosna.
Your greed has driven you to disobey a city official. In accepting the bribe from Shelly Dibbles, you shall no longer be trusted in Brosna.
The Book of T'Kan
Trente has given you a book to take to his friend Murian Brown in Tobaro. He says you will find Murian in "The Drowned Rat".
You have delivered The Book of T'Kan to Murian in The Drowned Rat in Tobaro.
The Cruel Wizard

Ranna has asked that you investigate reports of mistreatment of animals in the Halfling Wood. She wants you to free one of each animal being held in Trevor's Pet Shop. The Halfling Wood is located beyond the Ornal Pass, west of Benzor.
Ranna rewarded you with a ring after freeing six of the animals held in Magical Trevor's pet shop.
The Gatekeeper
A strange gnome on Gurnal Island has invited you to play with his pet dragons.
The Gatekeeper has given you a reward for completing his Dragon Farm.
The Goblin Nest
Goisur has requested that you help clear out the goblins uncovered by the Gracklstugh miners. You should look for some kind of chief goblin and retreive his head.
Now that the goblins have been removed from the Gracklstugh mines, the miners can continue working in peace.
The Lost Wine
A dwarf named Ronus has locked himself in the storeroom of the Wibblesford Wing of Tyln Castle. He has lost his master's vintage bottle of wine.
Ronus was pleased that you found his master's bottle of vintage wine.
The Mayor of Trondor
The Mayor of Trondor needs your assistance. You should sail to Trondor immediately, and find the Mayor.
The mayor wants you to investigate claims that Dorneryll's farm is being attacked by Goblins. To reach the farm, head north through the Trondor Pass, and take the Western fork in the road.
You have discovered Dorneryll's Sheath on a Goblin Scout in the farm. The mayor would probably be interested in seeing it.
The mayor would like you to find the goblins' lair.
You have found the goblins' cave and slain the head gobin, Grun Bak. You should return to the Mayor and tell him of your findings.
You have slain the goblin responsible for the deaths of the Dorneryll family, and the village of Trondor is once again at peace.
Trommel Mines

The Duke of Brosna has asked you to find out why he has stopped receiving shipments from the Trommel Mines. To reach the mines, travel west from Brosna until you reach the Trommel Woods. Then take the fork in the road to the north.
You have returned to the Duke of Brosna with the black dragon scales, and he has rewarded you with the Stone of Brosna.
Tucker's Signet Ring
A gang leader named Fagan is rumored to have pinched Captain Tucker's Signet Ring. He owns a house in the West Benzor Slums.
You should return the ring to Captain Tucker in Benzor immediately.
Captain Tucker was grateful that you were able to return his ring.
The Servant of Vhaerun in Underdark Central has asked you to travel to Chaulssin and read about the Great Drow Wars.
You found a copy of The Great Drow Wars in the Chaulssin Library. You should return to Underdark Central and talk to The Servant of Vhaerun.

Your next task is to find Kai'leth Brodock and retrieve Vhaerun's Amulet of Drow Strength. Vhaerun's Servant has warned you that Kai'leth has many Benzor Elite Guards under his command, and will be difficult to defeat. A halfling called Burton Longbottom may be able to help you find Kai'leth.
Burton Longbottom has informed you that Kai'leth has a farm west of the city of Brosna. Burton would also like you to return a trinket to him that the elite guards took long ago.
Burton Longbottom has told you that the Benzor Elite Guard Stronghold is located in the surfacer city of Tobaro. You will be able to find Kai'leth there, and retreive his Amulet of Drow Strength.
You have sucessfully returned the Amulet of Drow Power to Vhaerun's Servant.
